bib.title: Negative effects of incentivised viral campaigns for activity in social networks
bib.author: Michalski, Radoslaw and Jankowski, Jaroslaw and Kazienko, Przemyslaw
bib.abstract: Viral campaigns are crucial methods for word-of-mouth marketing in social communities. The goal of these campaigns is to encourage people for activity. The problem of incentivised and non-incentivised campaigns is studied in the paper. Based on the data collected within the real social networking site both approaches were compared. The experimental results revealed that a highly motivated campaign not necessarily provides better results due to overlapping effect. Additional studies have shown that the behaviour of individual
bib.booktitle: 2012 Second International Conference on Cloud and Green Computing
